text.name: console_notes
text.text: The Sega Mega Drive, called the Sega Genesis in North America and Super Gam*Boy (later Super Aladdin Boy) in South Korea, is a cartridge-based video game console developed by Sega in 1988. The Mega Drive is Sega's third home console, following the SG-1000 (including SG-1000 II) and the Sega Master System (Mark III). It was codenamed the Sega Mark V during development and is part of what is now known as the fourth generation of video game consoles. The Mega Drive is Sega's most successful video game console, selling over 40 million units worldwide.

text.name: memory
text.text: Memory: 64 KB main RAM and 64 KB video RAM

text.name: sound
text.text: Sound: Yamaha YM2612, Texas Instruments SN76489A
